NENA_corpus.name: North Eastern Neo-Aramaic Text Corpus
NENA_corpus.origin: The NENA text corpus is derived from decades of fieldwork by Professor Geoffrey Khan and his colleagues at the University of Cambridge, Faculty of Asian and Middle Eastern Studies
NENA_corpus.license: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International Public License
NENA_corpus.editors: Geoffrey Khan, Eleanor Coghill, Roberta Borghero, Lidia Napiorkowska, Hezy Mutzafi, Alinda Damsma, Paul Noorlander, Dorota Molin, Johan Lundberg
NENA_corpus.scientific_programmers: Cody Kingham, James Strachan, Dirk Roorda, Hannes Vlaardingerbroek

corpus_objects.text: transcribed story from a native NENA informant
corpus_objects.line: verse-like section used for reference; corresponds with publications where applicable
corpus_objects.sentence: sentence based on one or more of the following punctuators [.!?]
corpus_objects.subsentence: part of sentence based on one of the following punctuators: [;,—:]
corpus_objects.inton: intonation group of words/letters based on ˈ symbol (superscript |), which marks such boundaries
corpus_objects.stress: stress group of words, marked either by hyphenated segments or standalone words; e.g. 'xa-ga' is 2 words, 1 stress group
corpus_objects.word: word in NENA or other language segmented by either whitespace or one of [-=]
corpus_objects.letter: an individual letter including diacritics recognized by pattern matches against canonical NENA alphabet

dialect.about: name of a dialect in North Eastern Neo-Aramaic

text_id.about: id of a text within its original publication; can overlap between publications

speakers.about: names of speakers found in a text

line_number.about: sequential number of a line for reference purposes; corresponds with publications where applicable

text.about: utf8 text representation of a letter or word

full.about: full transcription, one-to-one transcription of a letter or word

lite.about: lite transcription of a letter or word, without vowel accents

fuzzy.about: fuzzy transcription that leaves out most diacritics and maps certain characters in certain dialects to common characters

text_end.about: space, punctuation, or other stylistic text at the end a letter or word

full_end.about: full transcription of punctuation or other stylistic text at the end of a letter or word; see also trans_f

lite_end.about: lite transcription of punctuation or other stylistic text at the end of a letter or word, excluding intonation boundary markers; see also trans_l

fuzzy_end.about: fuzzy transcription of punctuation or other stylistic text at the end of a letter or word, excluding intonation boundary markers; see also trans_l

text_nostress_end.about: non-stressed transcription of punctuation or other stylistic text at the end of a letter or word, excluding intonation boundary markers; see also trans_l

text_begin.about: space, punctuation, or other stylistic text at the beginning a letter or word

full_begin.about: full transcription of punctuation or other stylistic text at the beginning of a letter or word; see also trans_f

lite_begin.about: lite transcription of punctuation or other stylistic text at the beginning of a letter or word, excluding intonation boundary markers; see also trans_l

fuzzy_begin.about: fuzzy transcription of punctuation or other stylistic text at the end of a letter or word, excluding intonation boundary markers; see also trans_l

timestamp.about: timestamp in original audio after which a given word is spoken

speaker.about: name of person speaking a given word

phonetic_class.about: class of a letter (consonant or vowel)

phonetic_place.about: place of articulation of a given letter

phonetic_manner.about: manner of the sound of a letter

nu_class.about: semantic class of a word's grammatical number

gloss.about: English gloss of a word lemma, if available

n_parses.about: number of parsings matched to a word's surface form
